name: 施欣文
objective:
本課程旨在引導學生如何以批評的角度閱讀小說。課程討論有兩個重點：（一）小說的技巧：如情節、結構、人物塑造、敘事者與敘事策略、背景鋪陳、象徵與意象等。（二）小說與文學理論的關係：如何將文學理論運用到小說的閱讀與分析。
This course will introduce students to critical approaches and principles in the study of fiction.  We will discuss such features as plot, structure, characterization, narrator, narrative strategy, setting, symbol, image, etc..  We will also examine various theoretical approaches that can be brought to bear on the study of fiction.  There will be a particular emphasis on the application of theories to hone students' critical reading skills.
schedule: Students will read four texts: Alice's Adventures in Wonderland and Through the Looking-Glass (This reading will occur completely in class--out loud), Charlotte Bronte's Jane Eyre, parts of Mark Twain's Huckleberry Finn (much of which will be aloud), and George Orwell's 1984.
scorePolicy:
In-class Writing and Reading Quizzes: 30%
Close Readings: 30% (two one-page papers doing a close reading of the text: up to four attempts are possible) 
Final: 25%
In-class Activities and Participation: 15%
materials:
Alice's Adventures in Wonderland and Through the Looking-Glass 
Charlotte Bronte's Jane Eyre
Mark Twain's Huckleberry Finn 
George Orwell's 1984.
